wikipedia_page.main: James Vaughan Owen (born 14 January 1991) is a Welsh footballer who plays for Connah's Quay Nomads. He began his career with Chester City, but left in January 2010 when the club experienced financial difficulties.

response: Chester's Centre of Excellence was officially closed down at the start of the 2009–2010 season, due to the club's relegation to the Conference National, although most players remained at the club, with several, such as James Owen, Jack Rea and Lloyd Ellams playing in the senior side in the club's final season.
* James Owen (American politician) (1784–1865), U.S. Representative from North Carolina 1817–1819
* James Owen (footballer) (born 1991), Welsh footballer with Barrow
* James Owen (British author) (born 1969), British historian and journalist
